content:
• Thursday, May 24, 2018
  • MRVL

    Marvell +3.4% as CFIUS finds no issue with Cavium merger

    • Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) is up 3.4% after hours following its announcement that a government review of its merger with Cavium (CAVM) has found no concerns.
    • The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States has found no unresolved national security issues, Marvell said.
    • The deal still needs regulatory approval from China; the company still expects to close the merger mid-2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin +5% on FDA approval of metabolic disorder treatment

    • BioMarin Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:BMRN) +4.7% after-hours on news it received FDA approval of its Palynziq injection to reduce blood phenylalanine concentrations in adult patients with phenylketonuria, a rare metabolic disorder.
    • Phenylketonuria, or PKU, is a rare genetic disease that manifests at birth and results in a variety of cumulative toxic effects on the brain.
    • BMRN says Palynziq is the first approved enzyme substitution therapy to target the underlying cause of PKU by helping the body to break down blood phenylalanine; it is BMRN's second approved treatment for the condition.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM | 7 Comments
  • YRD

    Yirendai EPS of $1.72

    • Yirendai (NYSE:YRD): Q1 EPS of $1.72 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.99.
    • Revenue of $253.91M (+71.1% Y/Y) beats by $4.76M.
    • Shares +1.67% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 15 Comments
  • MRVL

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/24/2018)

    • Gainers: CAVM +6.1%. DECK +4.1%. NWY +3.9%. AMRN +3.8%. MRVL +2.1%.
    • Losers: ZOES -21.0 GERN -7.6%. GPS -7.4%. ROST -5.5%. ADSK -5.1%.

  • ZOES

    Zoe's Kitchen -21% after Q1 miss, full-year revenue guidance cut

    • Zoe's Kitchen (NYSE:ZOES) -21.4% after-hours as the restaurant chains reported a larger than expected Q1 loss and cut FY 2018 revenue guidance below Wall Street consensus.
    • Q1 revenues rose 13% Y/Y to $102M but same-restaurant sales slid 2.3% Y/Y due to weather and calendar shifts as well as less dine-in traffic;  analysts had expected a 0.5% increase in same-restaurant sales.
    • Zoe's reduces its revenue guidance for FY 218, forecasting revenues of $345M-$352M vs. its earlier outlook of $358M-$368M and below $361M analyst consensus estimate; same-restaurant sales are seen declining by 2%-4%, vs. expectations of flat to 2% higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • EGHT

    Comms firm 8x8 -4.8% after surprise Q4 loss

    • Comms firm 8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT) is off 4.8% after hours following fiscal Q4 earnings where it posted a surprise loss though revenues grew nearly 20%.
    • Service revenues grew 20% (19% in constant currency); total revenues rose 19% (18% in constant currency).
    • Service revenue from midmarket and enterprise customers rose 29% and made up 60% of total service revenue.
    • The quarter marked a "strong finish to a transformational year at 8x8," says CEO Vik Verma.
    • Gross margin (GAAP basis) was 75%, down from a year-ago 77%; non-GAAP gross margin was 77%, down from 79%. Non-GAAP service margin was 83%, down from a year-ago 84%.
    • Cash from operations was $2.7M.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to service revenue of $77M-$78M and a non-GAAP pretax loss of $4M to $5M.
    • For the full year (under ASC 606) it sees service revenue of $333M-$338M (19-21% Y/Y gain), total revenue of $347M-$352M (on the high side of consensus for $348.5M) and non-GAAP pretax loss of $13M to $17M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Micron still trading higher on analyst day, $10B share repurchase

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) shares closed today up 2.5% still gaining on Monday’s analyst day and $10B share repurchase announcement.
    • Micron shares are up 12.4% this week, over 29% this month, and 112.1% over the past year.   
    • The company will report Q3 results on June 20.          
    • Previously: Micron raises Q3 guidance ahead of analyst day; shares +4.1% (May 21)
    • Previously: Micron +2.9% on $10B share repurchase program (May 21)
    • Previously: Micron target raised to Street high after analyst day (May 22)
    • Previously: Needham raises its Micron target to 69% upside (May 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 58 Comments
  • DXC

    DXC Technology reports Q4 beats

    • DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) drops 1.9% aftermarket despite a Q4 report that beat revenue and EPS estimates with a 234% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • Key metrics: Global Business Services revenue, $2.4B (+3.3% Y/Y pro forma); Global Infrastructure Services, $3.2B (+3.6%); United States Public Sector, $710M (+11%); Adjusted EBIT, $1.02B; Adjusted EBIT margin, 16.2% (+6 pts Y/Y); net cash from operating activities, $701M; FCF, $557M. 
    • Press release. 
    • Previously: DXC Technology beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (May 24)
    • Previously: DXC Technology declares $0.19 dividend (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • VEEV

    Veeva Systems reports Q1 beats, upside guidance

    • Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV) drops 0.2% on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 22% Y/Y revenue growth. Upside Q2 guidance has revenue of $203M to $204M (consensus: $198.76M) and EPS from $0.33 to $0.34 (consensus: $0.32). 
    • Revised upside FY19 guidance has revenue from $826M to $830M (consensus: $818.77M; was: $815M to $820M) and EPS from $1.36 to $1.38 (consensus: $1.32; was: $1.30 to $1.33).
    • Earnings call began at 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast/replay available here. 
    • Press release.        
    • Previously: Veeva Systems beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 15 Comments
  • AMRN

    Amarin settles Vascepa patent challenge with Teva; shares up 2% after hours

    • Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) is up 2% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that it has settled its patent litigation with Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (NYSE:TEVA) related to the latter's U.S. marketing application seeking approval for a generic version of Vascepa (icosapent ethyl).
    • Under the terms of the settlement agreement, Teva may begin selling its generic version on August 9, 2029 or earlier under certain circumstances.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 7 Comments
  • NTNX

    Nutanix -4.8% on mixed Q1, mixed guidance

    • Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) drops 4.8% on Q3 results that beat revenue estimates with a 41% Y/Y growth but missed on EPS. Mixed Q4 guidance has revenue of $295M to $300M (consensus: $288.99M) and EPS of -$0.22 to -$0.20 (consensus: -$0.13). Non-GAAP gross margin expected from 73% to 74%. 
    • Key metrics: Billings, $351.2 (+50% Y/Y); non-GAAP gross margin, 68.4% (+7.3 pts); cash and investments, $923.5M (+164%); deferred revenue, $539.9M (+62%); operating cash flow, $13.3M ; FCF, -$0.8M; total operating expenses, $217M.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Nutanix misses by $0.02, beats on revenue (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 24 Comments
  • ADSK

    Autodesk -4.4% on Q1 beats, downside EPS guide for Q2

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) drops 4.4% on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 15% Y/Y revenue growth. Q2 guidance has in-line revenue from $595M to $605M (consensus: $598.5M) and downside EPS from $0.13 to $0.16 (consensus: $0.18).
    • FY19 guidance has upside revenue from $2.56B to $2.66B (consensus: $2.5B) and in-line EPS of $0.77 to $0.95 (consensus: $0.90). 
    • Key metrics: Subscription plan ARR, $1.4B (+103% Y/Y); total ARR, $2.13B (+22%); subscription plan subscriptions, 2.57M (+307K); deferred revenue, $1.81B (flat); billings, $411M (-18% due largely to ASC606); operating expenses, $548.4M; cash and equivalents, $1.1B. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Autodesk beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • GPS

    Gap disappoints with sales momentum

    • Investors were expecting more out of Gap's (NYSE:GPS) full-year guidance after several mall peers painted a rosy picture for a roughly overlapping period.
    • Gap says it still sees comparable sales growth to flat to up and slightly and FY19 EPS of $2.55 to $2.70.
    • As for Q1, Gap reported a 3% comp for Old Navy and Banana Republic, while Gap Global sales were down 4%. The overall +1.0% comp missed the consensus estimate of +1.5%.
    • Shares of Gap are down 7.89% in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk down 1.2% on Q1 beats, upside guide; operating margin -4.7%

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) drops 1.2% despite Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 29% Y/Y revenue growth. Upside Q2 guidance has revenue of $356M to $358M (consensus: $354.29) with operating margin at around 2%.
    • Raised upside FY19 guidance has revenue of $1.645B (consensus: $1.63; was: $1.625B) with a reaffirmed operating margin at 11.5%. 
    • Key metrics: Software revenues, $172.5M (+43% Y/Y); non-GAAP operating margin, -4.7%; operating cash flow, $76.5M; FCF, $74.2M; new enterprise customers, 460; operating expenses, $355.1M; cash and equivalents, $481.8M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.            
    • Previously: Splunk beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum to buy Permian acreage for $570M, plans 22M-share offering

    • Callon Petroleum (NYSE:CPE) -5.8% after-hours as it agrees to acquire certain producing oil and gas properties and undeveloped acreage in the Permian Basin from Cimarex Energy (NYSE:XEC) for $570M.
    • CPE says the deal will add ~28.6K net surface acres to its Spur operating area in the Delaware Basin that is directly adjacent and complementary to its existing leasehold position, which will total ~47.5K net acres upon completion.
    • Net production of the acreage totaled 6,831 boe/day (73% oil) during Q1.
    • To help fund the deal, CPE plans a public offering of 22M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 3.3M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 19 Comments
  • DXC

    DXC Technology beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC): Q4 EPS of $2.28 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $6.29B (+232.8% Y/Y) beats by $170M.
    • Shares +1.81%.

  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoor rides higher after earnings

    • Deckers Brands (NASDAQ:DECK) reports sales rose 6.6% on a constant currency basis. in FQ4.
    • UGG brand sales rose 6.0% during the quarter and Teva sales were up 7.3%.
    • Gross margin improved 220 bps to 48.9% of sales off the extra leverage.
    • DTC net sales increased 18.1% to $177.6M.
    • FY19 guidance: Net sales are expected to be in the range of $1.925B to $1.950B; Gross margin slightly better than 49.0%; SG&A expenses slightly better than 36.5%; Operating margin 12.6%-12.8%; Effective tax rate of ~2.0%, EPS in a range of $6.20 to $6.40 vs. $6.02 consensus.
    • DECK +6.03% AH to $109.99.
    • Previously: Deckers Outdoor beats by $0.31, beats on revenue (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 2 Comments

    Deckers Outdoor beats by $0.31, beats on revenue

  • ROST

    Soft guidance trips up Ross Stores

    • Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) reports comparable sales increased 3% in Q1 to match the pace from a year ago.
    • Operating margin was 15.1% of sales, down from a year ago after higher freight costs more than offset merchandise gross margin improvement and favorable timing of packaway-related expenses.
    • Ross Stores expects comparable sales growth of 1% to 2% for Q2 and EPS of $0.95 to $0.99 vs. $1.03 consensus. The retailer sees FY19 EPS of $3.92 to $4.05 vs. $4.09 consensus.
    • Shares of Ross Stores are down 4.46% in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 11 Comments
  • DISH

    Dish Network plans $1B IoT buildout, with 5G funding closer to $10B

    • Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) is looking to spend up to $1B on a nationwide Internet of Things network over the next couple of years -- and likely more than 10 times that on a nationwide 5G network.
    • Company co-founder Charlie Ergen, now the ex-CEO as he focuses on Dish's wireless assets, says phase one of a two-part buildout will cost $500M to $1B, but that it will use narrowband tech and that radios have been ordered and cores will be implemented during the summer setting up for fall testing.
    • The company will want to wait on more standards for 5G but hopes a $10B buildout will get a network that will power next-gen technologies built on wireless.
    • Addressing the company's lack of experience in the area: "This is a start-up business for us."
    • Shares closed down 1.6% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 9 Comments
  • GHC

    Graham Holdings prices $400M in 5.75% notes

    • Graham Holdings (GHC +2.1%) has priced an offering of $400M in debt.
    • The company's offering that amount in senior unsecured notes due 2026, at 5.75% coupon. The notes were priced at 100% of principal.
    • Net proceeds will redeem all $400M of its existing 7.25% notes due 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • FANG

    Diamondback among E&P laggards as Midland differential weakens

    • Diamondback Energy (FANG -3.2%) sinks more than 3% as the Midland crude differential widened $3.25 to $12.75/bbl today, according to Bloomberg data.
    • Analysts at Raymond James said earlier this week that they expect the Midland discount to remain at least $10/bbl for most of 2019.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
    • Earlier: Crude oil prices lose steam on expectations of more production (May 24)
    • ETFs: XOP, GUSH, DRIP, IEO, NDP, PXE
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 14 Comments

    Calavo Growers slides after KRoger-Home Chef deal

    • Calavo Growers (NASDAQ:CVGW) is down 6.16% after Kroger acquired meal-kit specialist Home Chef.
    • The deal could limit the upside potential for FreshRealm, a meal kit player that Calavo holds a 40% stake in.
    • Shares of Calavo trade at a six-week low.

  • AAPL

    Judge says Apple knew iPhone 6 was more prone to bending

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) knew its iPhone 6 and 6 Plus phones were more prone to bending than previous models even with regular use.
    • The information came out in an unsealed judicial opinion related to a class action lawsuit around “Bendgate.” 
    • Federal judge Lucy Koh in San Jose declined to allow the class action suit but wrote that Apple had conducted an internal investigation of the bending issues and found that the iPhone 7 was 3.3x more likely to bend than the iPhone 5s. The 7 Plus was 7.2x more likely to bend than the iPhone 5s. 
    • Apple publicly maintained there weren’t design problems with the phones but engineers started addressing the issue with more epoxy and stronger aluminum shells. 
    • Apple shares are down 0.1% to $188.14.  
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 118 Comments
  • ET

    Administrative judge stops Mariner East 1, construction on Mariner East 2

    • Operations on Energy Transfer Partners' (ETP -2.1%) Sunoco Mariner East 1 pipeline and construction on the Mariner East 2 and Mariner East 2X pipelines in an eastern Pennsylvania town are stopped by an administrative law judge, citing three leaks in the Mariner East 1 over the past year where the company "failed to identify leaks... and failed to report the leak or spill to proper authorities when they occurred."
    • "Sunoco is putting West Whiteland Township's water supplies at risk by failing to adequately identify, document and avoid drilling through well or acquifer locations underground" on the 330-mile route through Pennsylvania, the judge rules.
    • The judge says "an imminent risk to the public" prompts the need for further study on the projects for the state Public Utility Commission to evaluate before construction should resume on Mariner East 2 and 2X in West Whiteland.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 110 Comments
  • SAFM

    Highlights from Sanderson Farms' conference call

    • Sanderson Farms (SAFM -1.9%) confirmed on today's earnings conference call that exports to Mexico started up again yesterday after a pause due to the detection of Newcastle disease in California.
    • Company execs also said that global demand has stayed strong this spring even with trade issues and politics in the background, although there was weak food service demand for boneless breast meat and jumbo wings.
    • Sanderson Farms conference call webcast
    • Previously: Weak pricing impacts Sanderson Farms (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • PBR

    Analysts pile on with downgrades after Petrobras cuts Brazil diesel prices

    • Petrobras (PBR -16%) plunges after announcing it will temporarily cut diesel prices in Brazil in an attempt to placate 200K-plus truckers whose strike over rising fuel costs threatens to create food shortages and wreak havoc on the country’s exports.
    • BofA Merrill Lynch, Credit Suisse and Morgan Stanley all downgraded shares to Neutral in response, reflecting investor fears of the loss of PBR's pricing independence despite CEO Pedro Parente’s insistence that it had not been damaged.
    • Credit Suisse analysts disagree with the CEO, as the recent events "have brought [PBR's] technical pricing policy to the political debate and we fear that it increases risks of interference."
    • Morgan Stanley says “the perception of renewed external intervention in pricing policy... is enough for [the market’s] confidence to wane.”
    • BAML believes PBR's move could set a precedent for future ad hoc decisions, which would be “very negative” for the company based on its history.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 18 Comments

  • Stocks claw back most early losses; energy tanks alongside oil

    • Down more than 1% at its session low, the Dow is off just 0.3% less than two hours before the close. The S&P 500 is lower by 0.2%, and the Nasdaq has returned to flat.
    • The president's canceling of his June summit with the North Korean strongman was the excuse for this morning's selling.
    • Gold has managed to hang onto its gains, up 1.2%, and the 10-year Treasury yield remains down 1.6 basis points to 2.978%.
    • Looking at S&P sectors, energy (XLE -1.4%) is the day's big loser as oil drops 1.5%. Financials (XLF -0.7%) are next in line in the loss column.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 14 Comments
  • DERM

    Dermira Investor Day fails to stoke buying, shares down 15%

    • Dermira (DERM -14.7%) slumps on average volume after the company's investor update earlier today.
    • Presented rationale for hyperhidrosis candidate glycopyrronium tosylate (topically administered) plus late-stage trial data. On the safety front, the rate of treatment-emergent adverse events was 56%, most mild and transient. AEs decreased over time (0-4 weeks to more than 36 weeks). FDA action date for NDA is June 30.
    • Commercial strategy: direct promotion via 112 sales specialists who will target ~11K medical providers, mostly dermatologists, nurse practitioners and physician assistants.
    • Eight reps will target payers to establish coverage. Discussions already taken place with insurers/PBMs representing 82% of all commercially covered lives. Co. expects "quality" coverage. Full market launch planned for October 1.
    • Presented rationale for atopic dermatitis candidate lebrikizumab. Phase 2b study expected to be fully enrolled by year-end. Topline data in H1 2019.
    • Will not provide sales guidance. Product revenue will recognized upon sale to wholesalers, not the sale-through to patients.
    • Previously: Dermira's olumacostat glasaretil flunks late-stage studies in acne vulgaris; shares halted (March 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 1 Comment

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (05/24/2018)

  • VDNRF

    Indian state seeks permanent closure of Vedanta's copper smelter

    • India’s Tamil Nadu state says it is seeking a permanent closure of the big copper smelter run by Vedanta Resources (OTCPK:VDNRF -5.4%) after 13 protesters demanding the plant's closure were shot and killed by police.
    • The pollution control board of Tamil Nadu also says the smelter, which was shut pending renewal of its operating license, was discovered to have been preparing to resume production without permission.
    • The deadly protests are a blow to the ambitions of Indian billionaire Anil Agarwal to turn Vedanta into a global resources giant.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 1 Comment

    • Losers: ATLC -9%. GROW -8%. IHT -7%. LX -6%. DB -5%.

    Midday Gainers / Losers (05/24/2018)

  • THR

    Thermon Group down 3% on Q4, downside revenue guidance

    • Thermon Group (THR -3.5%) reported Q4 revenue growth of 51.8% Y/Y to $102.8M, organic revenue was $77.6M and revenue from THS (Thermon heating systems) was $25M.
    • Q4 Margins: Gross improved by 380 bps to 45.6%, positively impacted by improved Greenfield pricing leverage and project execution from organic business; operating improved by 540 bps to 13.2% and Adj. EBITDA improved by 665 bps to 22.04%.
    • Orders were $94.5M (+36% Y/Y), organic orders were $72.9M and orders from THS were $21.6M. Backlog was $159.6M (+49% Y/Y), organic backlog was $128M and backlog from THS was $31.7M.
    • Company made a debt prepayment of $25M on original principal amount of $250M.
    • FY19 Outlook: Revenue $360-370M vs $373.92 consensus, organic revenue growth between 3-5% and THS revenue between $85-90M.
    • Previously: Thermon misses by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • COWN

    Cowen Group files debt securities offering

    • Cowen Group (COWN -2.6%) files $162M debt securities offering.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • APA

    Apache commits Alpine High natural gas liquids to Enterprise pipeline

    • Apache (APA -2.5%) signs on as an anchor customer of Enterprise Products Partners' (EPD -1.1%) Shin Oak pipeline to transport natural gas liquids from west Texas' Alpine High development to EPD's storage hub in Mont Belvieu, Tex.
    • APA commits to move more than 200K bbl/day of NGLs on the pipeline, which will have an initial capacity of 550K bbl/day.
    • The pipeline is under construction and scheduled for completion in Q2 2019; APA has the option of purchasing a 33% stake in the Shin Oak pipeline, exercisable after the in-service date.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 16 Comments

  • MOD

    Post-earnings rally for Modine Manufacturing

    • Shares of Modine Manufacturing (NYSE:MOD) are up 5.96% after FQ4 results arrive ahead of estimates.
    • Sales in Asia were up 44%, while sales in Europe rose 21%.
    • Adjusted operating income was up 16% Y/Y during the quarter to $34.7M. The company points to strong performances in the Europe, Asia and CIS segments as leading operating income higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • OKTA

    Deutsche Bank raises its Okta target to 13% upside

    • Deutsche Bank maintains a Buy rating on Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) and raises the price target from $45 to $56.
    • New price target represents a 13% upside to yesterday’s close. 
    • Okta shares are up 1.6% to $50.33.       
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • ET

    Report: ETP's Rover pipeline flows reach new high as Phase 2 begins

    • Flows on Energy Transfer Partners' (ETP -2%) Rover pipeline project this week reached a new daily high of 1.8B cf/day, according to BTU Analytics.
    • Actual flows on the line rose by only 100M cf/day from its Phase 1 level, but the slight increase indicates that portions of Phase 2 are being used, BTU says.
    • Flows into Michigan have not been recorded, but BTU's Jake Fells expects them to begin on June 1, if not sooner; ETP has said the full project would be online by that date, but Fells thinks "a more realistic timeline would be mid-June."
    • The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission earlier this month approved Phase 2 facilities from Ohio to Michigan, which ETP executives have said means it can begin flows of 75% of the project's design capacity, or ~2.4B cf/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 10 Comments

  • TNXP

    Tonix Pharma completes pharmacokinetic bridging study for lead candidate Tonmya; shares up 3%

    • Tonix Pharmaceuticals (TNXP +3.4%) moves closer to an NDA filing for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) med Tonmya (cyclobenzaprine HCl sublingual tablets) with the conclusion of a multi-dose pharmacokinetic bridging study with the reference listed drug (RTD) AMRIX (cyclobenzaprine HCl extended-release capsules).
    • Preliminary data showed plasma levels and exposure of 5.6 mg of Tonmya were less than 30 mg of AMRIX after 20 days of dosing. Additionally, the systemic exposure of cyclobenzaprine and its principal active metabolite norcyclobenzaprine from Tonmya was less than AMRIX at steady-state. Adverse event data were as expected.
    • The aim of the bridging study is the affirm the validity of using safety data on AMRIX to support the Tonmya marketing application under the FDA's abbreviated 505(b)(2) pathway which allows the inclusion of data generated by others.
